definition: to stop (walking)/to halt
to halt/to stay/to be stationed (of troops, diplomats etc)
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample

sentences.english: It attracted many thousands of visitors from all levels of society.
sentences.chinese: 水晶宫曾吸收了社会各阶级的瞻仰者驻足欣赏。

sentences.english: The one unpardonable sin of nature is to stand still, to stagnate.
sentences.chinese: 自然界最不可饶恕的罪行就是驻足不前，淤滞停止。

sentences.english: Here was Stravinsky, a musical revolutionary whose own evolution never stopped.
sentences.chinese: 他就是史特拉汶斯基，一个从不驻足的音乐革命者。

sentences.english: Stop word in between teeth but don't know where to complain, circling back and forth.
sentences.chinese: 驻足在齿间的温语却不知从何诉起，来回的盘旋着。

sentences.english: Lie fallow health pleasing gentler atmosphere allow you Satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 休闲于身，舒坦在心，优雅氛围令您驻足美意绵绵。

sentences.english: He stood still,drinking in the beautiful view.
sentences.chinese: 他驻足不前，欣赏着美景。

sentences.english: Wai is so glad that he discovers Bo standing in the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 伟一天最高兴便是在听歌的人群中发现了驻足的宝。

sentences.english: Ambassador and Mrs. Huntsman pause to view a yak butter candle at Ganden Monastery.
sentences.chinese: 洪博培大使及夫人在甘丹寺内驻足观看牦牛酥油蜡烛。

sentences.english: I stick around hoping to meet more talkative mourners.
sentences.chinese: 我驻足四顾，希望和更多的悼唁者交流。

sentences.english: However, during the one-hour play, only six or seven people were truly appreciating the charming music.
sentences.chinese: 将近一小时的演奏中，真正驻足聆听者只有六七人。

sentences.english: Stop to summer, with branches parting, Jiangnan much rain.
sentences.chinese: 驻足夏日，叹花枝别离，江南多烟雨。

sentences.english: Shipping to the east, in town the star shone.
sentences.chinese: 渡海东行的星星，在城中驻足。

sentences.english: 4A monkey climbing a tree in a country park in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 一只猴子正爬在香港一家公园的大树上驻足了望。

sentences.english: The girl walked steadily north, pausing every now and then to check her direction.
sentences.chinese: 女孩稳建地往北走着，时不时地驻足查看一下方向。

sentences.english: They move to attract a large number of passers-by stop to watch.
sentences.chinese: 他们的举动，吸引大量路人驻足观看。

sentences.english: The greatest mistake to make is standing still.
sentences.chinese: 人生最大的错误是驻足不前。

definition: to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
a tourist
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
to stand for a long time
to wander/to ramble/recreational hiking/to perambulate
to pass by or through
a passer-by
to look at sth with pleasure/to watch (sth marvelous)/ornamental
scenery/landscape/CL:個|个[ge4]
to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter
variant of 流連|流连[liu2 lian2]
beautiful scenery
restless
to rest for a bit/to take a breather
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
to come to a place on account of its reputation (idiom); attracted to visit a famous location
